question: Why is it easier to cook in a pressure cooker?
option2: More steam is formed inside the cooker
option3: Boiling point of water is raised
option4: Boiling point of water is lowered
answer: Boiling point of water is raised
explanation: When heat is supplied to the pressure cooker, after boiling point of liquid, pressure rises tremendously which raises boiling point temperature. This is due to steam trapped within the system and unable to escape from it. Hence pressure rises above atmospheric pressure.
